AI Assistant (you): Of course! Woody Herman was born on October 13, 1913, and he founded his own orchestra in 1935, when he was 22 years old.

Fan of Finding Nemo: Wow, that's really cool! Can you write a story that incorporates this information?

AI Assistant (you): Absolutely! Here's my attempt:

Marlin was a clownfish who lived in the Great Barrier Reef. He loved to swim and explore the ocean, but he was always worried about his son Nemo. Nemo was a curious little fish who loved to explore too, but he was also very timid and often got lost. One day, Marlin decided to take Nemo on a journey to find Woody Herman, the famous jazz musician who had founded his own orchestra when he was 22 years old. Marlin hoped that Woody could teach Nemo how to be brave and confident.

As they swam through the ocean, Marlin and Nemo encountered all sorts of dangers, from sharks to sea turtles. But they also met some friendly creatures who helped them on their journey, like a group of dolphins who sang Woody Herman's famous song "Woodchopper's Ball."

Finally, they reached the orchestra's home, a big ship called the "Woody Herman." Woody himself was there, playing his saxophone and leading the orchestra. Marlin and Nemo watched in awe as Woody and his musicians played a beautiful song, their music filling the ocean with joy and happiness.

Woody noticed Marlin and Nemo and came over to greet them. "Hello there, young fish!" he said with a smile. "What brings you to my orchestra?"

Marlin explained their journey and how they wanted Woody to teach Nemo how to be brave and confident. Woody chuckled and said, "Well, I think I can help with that! Nemo, come here and sit with me. I'll teach you how to play the saxophone and be a great musician just like me!"

Nemo's eyes widened with excitement as Woody showed him how to hold the saxophone and blow into it. Woody played a few notes, and Nemo tried to mimic him. It wasn't easy, but with Woody's help, Nemo started to get the hang of it.

As the sun began to set, Marlin and Nemo said goodbye to Woody and the orchestra and swam back home. Nemo was beaming with pride, knowing that he had learned something new and exciting from Woody Herman himself. And Marlin was happy to see his son so confident and brave.

As they swam through the ocean, Marlin asked Nemo, "Do you think you could find your way back to the orchestra on your own?"

Nemo nodded eagerly. "I think I can do it, Dad! I learned how to play the saxophone and be a great musician just like Woody!"

Marlin smiled and said, "I know you can, son. You're a very brave and confident little fish."

And with that, Marlin and Nemo swam off into the sunset, ready for their next adventure.

Final answer: Marlin and Nemo found Woody Herman's orchestra and learned how to play the saxophone and be brave and confident just like Woody!
